definition: to conform with destiny/as the occasion demands
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
to emerge to meet a historic destiny (idiom)/to arise at an opportune time/able to take advantage of an opportunity/to rise to the occasion

sentences.english: As a result, electrocardiogram equipment with remote monitor ability becomes a trend.
sentences.chinese: 具有远程监控功能的心电仪应运而生。

sentences.english: The project named "Cryptographic Security Service Platform (CSSP)" appears in the background of these problems.
sentences.chinese: 密码安全服务平台就是在这样的背景下应运而生的。

sentences.english: Simultaneously logistics distribution center comes into existence with the increase of business portfolio.
sentences.chinese: 而随着企业物流量的急剧增加，配送中心应运而生。

sentences.english: Bashed on this, the core thought of this paper comes into being.
sentences.chinese: 本文的研究思路就是在此基础上应运而生的。

sentences.english: In order to solve this problem, the dynamic water injection balance technique is developed.
sentences.chinese: 为了解决回拖卡管问题，动态注水平衡技术应运而生。

sentences.english: In order to avoid the occurrence of the above, non-fusion technologies.
sentences.chinese: 为了避免上述情况的发生，非融合技术应运而生。

sentences.english: Along with the network popularization, the digital facsimile emerges as the times require.
sentences.chinese: 随着网络的普及，数字传真机应运而生。

sentences.english: And then, the Golden Taxation Project was carried out.
sentences.chinese: 因此，金税工程应运而生。

sentences.english: Jina trouble to remove your bathroom cabinets have emerged.
sentences.chinese: 为了免除您的集纳烦恼，浴室柜应运而生。

sentences.english: We need a new technology to solve these problems, therefore presswork watermarking is proposed.
sentences.chinese: 因次，印刷数字水印技术应运而生。

sentences.english: This situation gave rise to a socialist market economy.
sentences.chinese: 社会主义市场经济应运崛起。

sentences.english: Electrolyzed oxidizing water (EOW) has been regarded as a new sanitizer in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 酸性氧化电位水是近年来应运而生的一种新型消毒剂。

sentences.english: The non-direct affiliated hospitals have come into being.
sentences.chinese: 所谓非直管附属医院应运而生。

sentences.english: A lot of Peking opera modern drama reflecting the struggle life of revolution appeared at the historic moment.
sentences.chinese: 一批反映革命斗争生活的京剧现代戏应运而生。

sentences.english: In recent years, a variety of professional applications-oriented English education came into being.
sentences.chinese: 近年来，以各种专业应用为目标的英语教育应运而生。

sentences.english: Pet hospital was born then, accompanied by pet diagnosis and treatment disputes.
sentences.chinese: 宠物诊疗机构应运而生，宠物诊疗纠纷也相影如随。

definition: to evolve (of ideas, designs, constructions etc)/to develop and change
to comply/to conform to/in tune with/adapting to/to adjust to
to discard the old and introduce the new (idiom); to innovate
to spread out/to develop/to overflow/to amplify/superfluous
change of dynasties/clear out the old, bring in the new
to propose/to put forward (an idea)/to initiate
